abstract: DVD vendors in Yangon, Myanmar, say that police, occasionally accompanied by North Korean officials, are cracking down on pirated copies of controversial movie The Interview; comedy about fictitious CIA plot to kill North Korea's leader Kim Jong-un had been best seller but is now disappearing from larger stores as result of what appears to be pressure from North Korea.
lead_paragraph: DVD vendors said police officers were sometimes accompanied by North Korean officials as they visited shops to seize copies of the controversial film.

byline.contributor: Wai Moe reported from Yangon, and Choe Sang-Hun from Seoul, South Korea.
byline.original: By WAI MOE and CHOE SANG-HUN

snippet: DVD vendors said police officers were sometimes accompanied by North Korean officials as they visited shops to seize copies of the controversial film.

headline.main: Myanmar Sweeps Up Copies of Film Mocking Kim Jong-un
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Sweeps Up Copies of Film Mocking Kim Jong-un
